title: Riot, why are you nerfing Shen's only offensive move?
body:
http://www.surrenderat20.net/2016/08/823-pbe-update.html

>Shen
Twilight Assault (Q) 
Next 3 attack damage lowered to 2/2.5/3/3.5/4% of target's max health from 3/3.5/4/4.5/5%
Extra damage against minions/monsters hit reduced to 30/40/50/60/70 from 30/50/70/110

Shen's win rate, with the average number of people playing him having over 64 games with him, is 48.58%. He already suffers in lane because of his low tank stats, and his Q is the only thing that lets him survive in lane.

I suppose we should just drop all of our mains and play Riven again, because she got buffed for "not being viable against top laners." But let's nerf Shen again, he's broken apparently.

Edit: Hey, look, more nerfs.

>Ki Barrier (Passive) shield duration lowered to 1.5 from 2.5 seconds.

replies.body: Usually i can explain why riot is doing a change but this time i just, can't. It seems like there are literally no reasons for this.

I wish they'd give some context. Or just NOT GO THROUGH WITH THEM.

They already ruined his laning phase with the buffing of all the champions he counters, if they gut him like this I will quit this game immediately and never go back. This is an unjustifiable nerf, since his damage is reliant on his opponents being melee, in range, and short on mobility and CC. The least they could do is at least let it do the minimal amounts of damage it does now.

There's no need to get so mad right now. This has only been on the PBE one day, there's a good chance it'll get removed. 

Look at the warning at the top of every s@20 PBE post:

(Warning: PBE Content is tentative and subject to change - what you see below may not reflect what eventually gets pushed to live servers at the end of the cycle! Manage your expectations accordingly.)

To be fair to the OP, Riot has let a LOT of terrible balance decisions through the PBE, which seems to be more a testing ground for bugs than for gameplay balance. Most of the changes from PBE that were reverted IN PBE were ones that turned out to be massively OP or ones that weren't intended to be there.

THIS

Also, Riot has explicitly stated that the PBE is strictly to check for bugs to make sure they don't crash the servers when the patch goes live. They do internal play-testing on every change before it ever hits PBE, so for some reason Riot's play-testers swore that these changes don't make Shen feel like complete garbage (allegedly).

Sure, they sometimes remove stuff buts that's actually pretty rare. The warning is just covering so people don't complain too much if they do remove something (like Mandrake Wards). Even a lot of bugs make it through PBE testing, despite getting reported by PBE testers, if they don't make the game unstable (hi, Azir!).
Then why nerf damage done to minions and monsters? This is gonna make it even harder for him to get past laning phase.
ask akali senpai,worst champion to cs with,so damn squishy atm,you go for a cs and lose half your health only from an AA of the enemy champion

I have no idea why you are freaking out about the PBE changes.
It has literally come out with Yorick and it may very well be only for testing purposes and not ready for actual release.

They have 2 weeks to iterate and see if it's an appropriate nerf or not, if he even needs one.

Mostly because for everyone who DOESN'T drink the Riot-love kool-aid, the PBE obviously isn't an actual balance testing ground.
The number of obviously stupid decisions that ACTUALLY don't make it out of the PBE is appallingly low.

By the time a change has hit the PBE, Riot has already decided through their internal playtesting that it's fine. The only things that really ever get reverted are larger rework changes. Anything more minor (like a tweak to damage on a champion passive) almost always makes it through just fine.

Pretending that it's crazy to act as if a PBE change is going to make it past the PBE is just plain naive. 

Not to mention, even if it DIDN'T make it, they're not gonna know how people feel about it unless people speak up.

Either way, complaining about people having issues with something on the PBE is just plain stupid.

The way OP's post is worded is not sounding like an open discussion about the Shen changes but more like "wtf is Riot doing with these nerfs" that i'm seeing pop up way too much these days.

Shen's laning phase is generally safe and he has good minion management with his damage.
Simply lowering that but keeping his tank fighting capabilities will make him think twice about making 2 TP plays or risking losing minions to a push or make it generally a bit harder to clean up a lane and make a TP with knowing you haven't lost much gold.

- Alistar's changes that apparently everyone had an issue with (some change with his heal and Riot has said that they were testing extremes to see where it breaks) have never gone through.
- Riven's Edge mechanic was never released.
- There were some Eve ult changes to flat value and good AP ratio that apparently didn't go through and now, it's back to live functionality but with a lower CD.

There are a a lot of reverts going on on PBE but unfortunately, they are too small to anyone to pay heed to. Only the "big" stuff gets noticed and is always in the spotlight for "PBE this, PBE that".
Shen's laning phase requires him to jump on his opponent and hope they don't have CC, disengage, or more damage. Not to mention that poke screws him up hard.
He's strong in pro play in the current meta. That's it. Riot balances around LCS and master/challenger.
